meaning: A component of the CPU that performs arithmetic and logical operations
A logic gate that returns true if both boolean values are true
Software designed to run user-oriented tasks
A program that translates Assembly code into machine code
An expression that evaluates to true or false
A system of wires that connect components of a computer
A small amount of memory that is used to store frequently used data
A device that measures the rate at which a computer can perform operations
The number of cycles per second that a computer can perform. Measured in Hertz (Hz)
A service that stores data on a remote server
A program that translates code into machine code by creating a separate file storing the executable machine code
A component of the CPU that directs the flow of data and instructions
A duplicate processor used to increase processing speeds
The bus that carries data throughout the computer system
The process of locating all the fragments of a file and putting them back together
A computer system with a dedicated purpose within a larger device
A type of software that encrypts data
The cycle used by the processor to execute instructions
A type of non-volatile secondary storage using magnetic storage
A physical part of a computer system
Files stored on the user's computer system
A type of circuit made up of logic gates
A type of operator that takes one or two boolean inputs, applies logic to them, and returns a boolean output
The main storage region of a computer, consisting of RAM and ROM
Data that will not be deleted if power is lost
A logic gate that inverts a boolean value.
A special piece of software responsible for managing computer hardware, users and resources.
A type of storage storing data on an optical disk.
A logic gate that returns true if one or both of the values are true.
A volatile memory location storing data currently in use
A non-volatile memory location storing BIOS data. Cannot be written to.
Storage locations that are not directly connected to the CPU. Non-volatile.
The programs stored and run on a computer system
A type of storage hardware without moving parts
Software that assists with the management and maintenance of a computer system
A table showing the input and output of data through a logic gate or circuit
The means of communication between a user and a computer
Software that assists the OS to organise and maintain the computer system
Temporary data that will be deleted if the power is lost
